TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed DateTimeStyles extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the formatting options that customize string parsing for some date and time parsing methods.

remarks.format:
## Remarks DateTimeStyles values can be used with any of the following date and time parsing methods that include a parameter to define the interpretation of the style elements that may be present in the string to be parsed:
- <xref:System.DateTime.Parse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.DateTimeOffset.Parse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.DateTime.TryParse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.DateTimeOffset.TryParse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.DateTime.ParseExact%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.DateTime.TryParseExact%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
The `ParseExact` and `TryParseExact` methods can use any of the DateTimeStyles values. However, if none of the `Allow*` values is selected, the input string must have exactly the same white-space characters as the format string.
If the input string does not contain any indication of the time zone, the date and time parsing methods interpret the value of the date and time string based on the time zone setting for the operating system. To convert the date and time to the Universal Time or Greenwich Mean Time (GMT), the application should use the F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AdjustToUniversal?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True value. The same effect can be achieved by calling the M:System.DateTime.ToUniversalTime?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True or M:System.DateTimeOffset.ToUniversalTime?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True method. However, using the F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AdjustToUniversal?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True value with the date and time parsing method is more efficient.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles AdjustToUniversal = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Date and time are returned as a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). If the input string denotes a local time, through a time zone specifier or F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AssumeLocal?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, the date and time are converted from the local time to UTC. If the input string denotes a UTC time, through a time zone specifier or F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AssumeUniversal?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, no conversion occurs. If the input string does not denote a local or UTC time, no conversion occurs and the resulting P:System.DateTime.Kind?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True property is F:System.DateTimeKind.Unspecified?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value cannot be used with F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.RoundtripKind?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles AllowInnerWhite = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Extra white-space characters in the middle of the string must be ignored during parsing, except if they occur in the T:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True format patterns.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles AllowLeadingWhite = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Leading white-space characters must be ignored during parsing, except if they occur in the T:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True format patterns.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles AllowTrailingWhite = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Trailing white-space characters must be ignored during parsing, except if they occur in the T:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True format patterns.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles AllowWhiteSpaces = int32(7)

Docs.summary: Extra white-space characters anywhere in the string must be ignored during parsing, except if they occur in the T:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True format patterns. This value is a combination of the F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AllowLeadingWhite?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AllowTrailingWhite?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, and F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AllowInnerWhite?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True values.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles AssumeLocal = int32(32)

Docs.summary: If no time zone is specified in the parsed string, the string is assumed to denote a local time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value cannot be used with F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AssumeUniversal?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True or F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.RoundtripKind?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles AssumeUniversal = int32(64)

Docs.summary: If no time zone is specified in the parsed string, the string is assumed to denote a UTC.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value cannot be used with F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.AssumeLocal?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True or F:System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.RoundtripKind?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles NoCurrentDateDefault = int32(8)

Docs.summary: If the parsed string contains only the time and not the date, the parsing methods assume the Gregorian date with year = 1, month = 1, and day = 1. If this value is not used, the current date is assumed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Default formatting options must be used. This value represents the default style for the M:System.DateTime.Parse(System.String)?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True, M:System.DateTime.ParseExact(System.String,System.String,System.IFormatProvider)?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True, and M:System.DateTime.TryParse(System.String,System.DateTime@)?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles RoundtripKind = int32(128)

Docs.summary: The T:System.DateTimeKind?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True field of a date is preserved when a T:System.DateTime?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True object is converted to a string using the "o" or "r" standard format specifier, and the string is then converted back to a T:System.DateTime?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True object.
